div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1001 Olbia (mod. Parutino), Ochakov (752) raion, Nikolaev oblast, Ukraine, be- fore 1902 Burial: c. 410 B.C. Contents: 16 AR Olbia: st. with inscription ΕΜΙΝΑΚΟ (as Minns, p. 487) Disposition: (formerly Grand Duke Alex- ander Mikhailovich coll.) Leningrad 1; Odessa 1; London 1; Boston 1 † Shtern, ZOOID 25 (1904), "Protokoly," p. 54 Bertier de la Garde, NS (Russian) 1911, p. 58; 1913, p. 127 Minns, p. 487 † Karyszkowski, SA 1960, no. 1, pp. 179-95 (com- prehensive treatment with detailed bibli- ography) Publications of individual hd. coins: 1) CAH, Plates, III, p. 18, f = Mushmov, Sbornik Boris Diakovich (Plovdiv, 1927), p. 205, no. 27 = NC 1926, p. 117, no. 2; 2) Ratto Apr. 4, 1927, 941; 3) Baranowsky Feb. 25, 1931, 490; 4) Boston MFA II, 79; 5) Naville July 3, 1933, 1086; 6) Zograph, pl. 32, 1; 7) Sal'nikov, Pratsi Odes'kogo Derzhavnogo Universiteta, vol. 149, issue 7 (Odessa, 1959), p. 143, no. 3; 8) Karyszkowski, SA 1960 (citing coins in publications mentioned in 1, 4, 6, 7)
